name: Adenia viridiflora
description: Adenia viridiflora is a caudiciform (caudex-forming) plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly East Africa. It belongs to the Passifloraceae family and features a swollen, water-storing base (caudex) with climbing or trailing stems bearing green leaves. The plant displays an upright to climbing growth habit and can reach varying sizes depending on conditions. It produces small, green flowers. In its native habitat, it grows in well-draining soils in tropical regions. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds unique interest with its caudex form. It's popular among caudiciform plant enthusiasts for its distinctive swollen base.
